page.title: 02Housing in Blakenhall Area
page.content: The Blakenhall area is 1.5 kilometres to the south of the town centre. It is an old area of the town. It has many old terraced houses that were built in the nineteenth century. They are all close together and built in long lines. The streets are named after famous people and events. One of the streets is named after Wolverhamptons football club. It is called Wanderers Avenue. The houses were named after some of the players of the day, players who have all been forgotten now. As the houses were built a long time ago they need repairing. Many of them have had new windows put in and new roofs. This makes them look smart from the outside. Inside they have had things done like rewiring, rooms knocking into one and redecorating. The people who live in them are very happy.
